definition: clown/2nd earthly branch: 1-3 a.m., 12th solar month (6th January to 3rd February), year of the Ox/ancient Chinese compass point: 30°
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to be embarrassingly short of money
to cover up one's embarrassment/to hush up a scandal
lit. hiding the moon, shaming the flowers (idiom)/fig. female beauty exceeding even that of the natural world
to have no sense of shame/brazen

sentences.english: Then, humiliated , you will have to take the least important place.
sentences.chinese: 你就羞羞慚慚的退到末位上去了。

sentences.english: Then, humiliated, you will have to take the least important place.
sentences.chinese: 你就羞羞慚慚地退到末位上去了。

sentences.english: Janet went red in the face when you told that dirty joke.
sentences.chinese: 當你開那個下流玩笑時，珍妮特羞紅了臉。

sentences.english: She blushed for shyness when the young man smiled at her.
sentences.chinese: 當小夥子朝她微笑時，她羞紅了臉。

sentences.english: The girl flushed from modesty when the man praised her appearance.
sentences.chinese: 誇獎這姑娘長得漂亮時，她羞得臉紅了。

sentences.english: But God in adulteratede accelerates to adumbrate its memory beneath the blooming grass.
sentences.chinese: 然而上帝卻害了羞，促地把他的記憶埋藏在綠草下點。

sentences.english: Ashamed and afraid, TaJoe confided in no one.
sentences.chinese: 塔喬感到有羞又怕，便沒有給任何人說。

sentences.english: Elizabeth blushed and blushed again with shame and vexation.
sentences.chinese: 伊麗莎白又羞又惱，臉蛋兒紅了又紅。

sentences.english: Nikki began to feel abashed by his praise of her beauty.
sentences.chinese: 他讚美着尼基的美貌，使她羞得面紅耳赤。

sentences.english: She thrust the volume into the desk, turned the key, and burst out crying with shame and vexation.
sentences.chinese: 她馬上把書扔進抽屜，鎖上鎖，又羞又惱地大哭起來。

sentences.english: The visitor is grateful that he does not have to go in, and then flushes with shame.
sentences.chinese: 參觀者慶幸他沒有打開門進去，否則他會羞紅了臉的。

sentences.english: She looked ashamed ashamed stars, also forget the moon light leaning willow.
sentences.chinese: 她望羞了星星，也忘羞了上弦月輕倚柳梢頭。

sentences.english: She looked ashamed ashamed stars, also forget the moon light leaning willow.
sentences.chinese: 她望羞了星星，也忘羞了上弦月輕倚柳梢頭。

sentences.english: Janet went as red as a beetroot when you told that dirty joke.
sentences.chinese: 當你開那個下流玩笑時，珍妮特羞紅了臉。

sentences.english: Dick blushes with pleasure, when Annie calls him her sweetie pie.
sentences.chinese: 當安妮稱他爲我親愛的的時候，迪克高興得羞紅了臉。

sentences.english: Please translate:Dick blushes with pleasure, when Annie calls him her sweetie pie.
sentences.chinese: 當安妮稱他爲我親愛的的時候，迪克高興得羞紅了臉。

definition: to be angry at/to be displeased and annoyed
(of a girl) to feign anger coquettishly
